hanzi-su-wiki:
層

Значения

Слой, прослойка, этаж

Мнемоника

Скопление 曽, слои фекалий под сидящим человеком 尸.

Варианты

層, 层
purpleculture_pinyin:
céng
layer; stratum; laminated; floor (of a building); storey; classifier for layers; repeated; sheaf (math.)
слой; страта; ламинированный; этаж (здания); этаж; классификатор по слоям; повторяется; связка (математика)

Pictophonetic: 曾 indicates the sound; 尸 (body) conveys the meaning.

heisig_chinese_memo: Formerly a great battle took place on this land. &nbsp
heisig_constituent: stratum, flag, increase, formerly, horns, rice field, brains, sun, day
Keyword_KANJIDIC: stratum, social class, layer, story, floor
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: слой, социальный класс, слой, история, пол
koohiiStory1: The strata have piled up in an ever increasing pile of dirt. As the geologists go down the rocks, they flag each stratum with the name of the corresponding era.
koohiiStory2: Archaeologists at a dig site place small flags marking layers or strata of rock. Each of these layers was formerly the top layer. (This is not increase! Hseige keeps messing up).
jp_example_words:
階層(かいそう): class, level, stratum, hierarchy
一層(いっそう): much more, still more, all the more
高層(こうそう): upper
大層(たいそう): very much, exaggerated, very fine
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Behind the flag lies a mask—yet another layer of secrecy. You’re standing in front of a crowd, giving a rousing speech. Hiding your face is the flag of your country, and behind that flag you’re also wearing a mask, just in case the flag falls down. The extra layer of secrecy is just to be safe.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: These layers are meant to protect you. We all have layers we hide behind sometimes, you know? You can't be totally transparent with everyone.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Someone jumps up on stage and starts peeling off your layers! You stand there, first goes the flag, then the mask, then ... your soul (そう) is laid bare. No, literally. You don't have a body, your soul was under that mask. And now it's floating there for all to see.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Everyone in the crowd is completely silent, staring at your soul, with all of its layers peeled off.
Ru_Meaning: stratum, social class, layer, story, floor
Ru_Radicals: 并, 尸 (труп), 日 (день), 田 (рисовое поле)
Ru_trainchinese:
céng: (графема/сч.слово) слой, ярус, этаж; (счетное слово) этаж, слой, уровень
céng: (графема) накладываться, наслаиваться, повторяться
Kanshudo_mnemonic: formerly (曽) a corpse (尸), but now on a new level
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The flag extends past the top story of a building into the rising clouds.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " corpse " and " zeng ", the original meaning is heavy house. "Said the text": "The heavy house. From the corpse, Zeng Sheng." Duan Yucai's note: "The heavy house is also. Zeng Zhiyan is heavy. Great ancestors and great-grandsons are both. So the floor from Zeng is the heavy house. "𦒱 "Gongji": "Four Ah Chongwu." The note says: "Chongwu, Furuo." Later generations made a building for it. Mube said: "Lou, Chongwu." The extension is the ancestor of the heavy house, ancient It is also falsely added to it." The word " layer " is not found in oracle bones and bronze inscriptions. When it is said that " layer " is a borrowed word, the original word is "曾", see "曾". The Southern Dynasties Liang Liu Xiaochuo "The Monument of Qiyin Temple."

" Layer " often means overlap. "Yu Pian‧ Corpse Department": "Layers, heavy also." "Songs of the Chu: Calling the Soul": "Layered platforms, and a little closer to the mountains." Wang Yi's note: "Layers, tired, heavy."

" Layer " can also mean high. "Shui Jing Zhu ‧ Mishui": "The mountains are so steep that no one has risen to the top."

" Layer " is also used as a ladder. Tang Zhang Ji "Zhuyan": "Into Qianganli alone, the marginal rock stepping on the stone layer." The meaning of "stairway" can be blurred into a quantifier that expresses overlapping or accumulated things. Such as Tang Wang Zhihuan "Deng Guanquelou": "If you want to be a thousand miles away, you can go to the next level."

" Layer " can also be used as a quantifier to denote things covering the upper surface of an object, or sub-items and steps. The former is like "a layer of snow" and "three layers of paper" in modern Chinese, and the latter is like "a layer of concern" and "two layers of paper." Layers of doubt" etc.

" Layer " is also used as a noun to indicate a freely used unit of stratigraphic division in geology, such as "sedimentary rock layer". The meaning of dividing a unit by strata can be further extended to rank, stage or sequence. For example, the usage of "level" and "level" in modern Chinese comes from this meaning. "Level" is also a linguistic research term, which means the phenomenon that sounds with different sources of time and space are superimposed on the same language. Among the Chinese dialects, Min dialect has the most complicated level.
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " corpse " and " zeng ", the original meaning is heavy house.
humanum_full_description:
從「尸」，「曾」聲，本義為重屋。《說文》：「重屋也。从尸，曾聲。」段玉裁注：「重屋也。曾之言重也。曾祖，曾孫皆是也。故从曾之層爲重屋。《𦒱工記》：『四阿重屋。』注曰：『重屋，複笮也。』後人因之作樓。木部曰：『樓，重屋也。』引伸爲凡重曡之偁，古亦假增爲之。」 「層」字不見於甲骨、金文，一說「層」為借字，本字為「曾」，參見「曾」。南朝梁劉孝綽〈栖隱寺碑〉：「珠殿連雲，金層輝景。」

　　「層」常表示重疊。《玉篇‧尸部》：「層，重也。」《楚辭‧招魂》：「層臺累榭，臨高山些。」王逸注：「層，累，皆重也。」

　　「層」還能表示高，《水經注‧㶟水》：「山甚層峻，未有升其巔者。」

　　「層」也用作階梯，唐張籍〈竹巖〉：「獨入千竿裏，緣巖踏石層。」由「階梯」義可虛化為表示重疊或累積事物的量詞。如唐王之渙〈登鸛雀樓〉：「欲窮千里目，更上一層樓。」

　　「層」用作量詞還可表示覆蓋於物體上表面的東西或分項、分步的東西，前者如現代漢語「一層雪」、「三層紙」等，後者如「一層顧慮」、「兩層疑惑」等。

　　「層」也用作名詞，表示地質學中自由使用的地層劃分單位，如「沉積岩層」。由地層劃分單位之義可進一步引申為等級、階段或順序，如現代漢語中「層次」、「層級」之用法，皆來自此義。「層次」亦為語言學研究術語，表示時間與空間來源不同的音類疊置於同一語言的現象。漢語諸方言中以閩語層次最為複雜。

從「 尸 」，「 曾 」聲，本義為重屋。《說文》：「重屋也。从尸，曾聲。」段玉裁注：「重屋也。曾之言重也。曾祖，曾孫皆是也。故从曾之層爲重屋。《𦒱工記》：『四阿重屋。』注曰：『重屋，複笮也。』後人因之作樓。木部曰：『樓，重屋也。』引伸爲凡重曡之偁，古亦假增爲之。」 「 層 」字不見於甲骨、金文，一說「 層 」為借字，本字為「 曾 」，參見「 曾 」。南朝梁劉孝綽〈栖隱寺碑〉：「珠殿連雲，金層輝景。」 「 層 」常表示重疊。《玉篇‧尸部》：「層，重也。」《楚辭‧招魂》：「層臺累榭，臨高山些。」王逸注：「層，累，皆重也。」 「 層 」還能表示高，《水經注‧㶟水》：「山甚層峻，未有升其巔者。」 「 層 」也用作階梯，唐張籍〈竹巖〉：「獨入千竿裏，緣巖踏石層。」由「階梯」義可虛化為表示重疊或累積事物的量詞。如唐王之渙〈登鸛雀樓〉：「欲窮千里目，更上一層樓。」 「 層 」用作量詞還可表示覆蓋於物體上表面的東西或分項、分步的東西，前者如現代漢語「一層雪」、「三層紙」等，後者如「一層顧慮」、「兩層疑惑」等。 「 層 」也用作名詞，表示地質學中自由使用的地層劃分單位，如「沉積岩層」。由地層劃分單位之義可進一步引申為等級、階段或順序，如現代漢語中「層次」、「層級」之用法，皆來自此義。「層次」亦為語言學研究術語，表示時間與空間來源不同的音類疊置於同一語言的現象。漢語諸方言中以閩語層次最為複雜。

層字的基本解释

層
céng
见“层”。

層字的汉语字典释义

[①]［céng］
［《廣韻》昨棱切，平登，從。］
［《廣韻》作滕切，平登，精。］
“层1”的繁体字。“增2”的被通假字。
(1)重屋，楼房。
(2)重叠；重复。
(3)累叠，堆叠。
(4)高。
(5)深。参见“層壑”。
(6)量词。重，级。用于重叠或累积的事物。
(7)量词。用于指事、理的层次。
(8)量词。用于覆盖在物体表面上的东西。
(9)植物群落的结构单位。
(10)地质学中自由使用的地层划分单位。

層字的康熙字典解释

【寅集上】【尸字部】　層； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页303第40
【唐韻】胙棱切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】徂稜切，?音曾。【說文】重屋也。从尸曾聲。　又【玉篇】重也，累也。凡物之重者，通曰層。　又【增韻】級也，古通作曾。【史記·司馬相如傳】坌入曾宮之嵳峩。

層字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
層字的起名意思

暂无。

céng
вм. 层
Radicals: 尸, 曽  (flag, mask)
Meaning Mnemonic
Behind the flag lies a mask—yet another layer of secrecy. You’re standing in front of a crowd, giving a rousing speech. Hiding your face is the flag of your country, and behind that flag you’re also wearing a mask, just in case the flag falls down. The extra layer of secrecy is just to be safe.
These layers are meant to protect you. We all have layers we hide behind sometimes, you know? You can't be totally transparent with everyone.
Reading Mnemonic
Someone jumps up on stage and starts peeling off your layers! You stand there, first goes the flag, then the mask, then ... your soul (そう) is laid bare. No, literally. You don't have a body, your soul was under that mask. And now it's floating there for all to see.
Everyone in the crowd is completely silent, staring at your soul, with all of its layers peeled off.
